correctness.rationale: Major factual errors and schema issues. Key problems: (1) growthPerCycle: value set to 0.257 Å, but article reports ~0.257 nm/cycle (≈2.57 Å); unit/value mismatch by 10x and violates schema expectation for ANGSTROM with correct numeric value. (2) dosingTime/purgeTime: article gives 15 s / 10 s / 10 s / 10 s, but extraction encodes 15 and 10 with unit MilliSEC (should be 15000 ms and 10000 ms). (3) pressure: AP-ALE occurs at atmospheric pressure; extraction gives 0.106 mmHg without support. Table lists partial pressures (ZnCl2 ~10.6 Pa, O2 ~2.53×10^4 Pa), not the provided value. (4) flowRates: 33 sccm for precursor/co-reactant/purge is not traceable; article only provides total flow 33×10^-6 m^3/s and no per-line sccm. (5) nucleationPeriod: 5 cycles not reported. (6) plasmaPower: set to null; schema requires an object if present—omit entirely for thermal process. (7) Multiple material properties are fabricated and not supported by the article: optical properties (n, band gap, method), electrical properties (resistivity, carrier density, mobility), uniformity, conformality, filmComposition (XPS values and 1:1 ratio), roughness (0.5 nm AFM), filmDensity—all unreported. (8) reactor name slightly inaccurate vs. “horizontal type quartz hot-wall reactor.” Positives: substrate, precursor/co-reactant, carrier/purge gas, temperature (748 K), number of cycles (200), film thickness (51.7 nm), and crystallinity (epitaxial by XRD) match. To correct: fix GPC to ~2.57 Å; convert all times to milliseconds; set pressure to atmospheric or report partial pressures correctly; remove unsupported flow rates, nucleation period, material/device properties; remove plasmaPower or provide a valid object only if PEALD; align reactor description with article.

completeness.rationale: Largely incomplete and inaccurate relative to the article and with several schema issues. Key problems: (1) Process coverage: only one process is extracted, while the article reports multiple runs (50–1200 cycles; growth temperature 673–873 K with epitaxy at 723–823 K). Distinct processes/conditions are not represented. (2) ALD method misclassified: AP-ALE with spatial separation should map to SALD, not TALD. (3) Schema violations/inconsistencies: plasmaPower is set to null (should be omitted); dosingTime and purgeTime use unit MilliSEC but values are given as 15 and 10 (should be 15000 ms and 10000 ms for 15 s and 10 s); growthPerCycle uses ANGSTROM but numeric 0.257 corresponds to nm—should be about 2.57 Å/cycle (also consistent with 51.7 nm/200 cycles ≈ 2.585 Å/cycle); reactor name does not match text (“horizontal type quartz hot-wall reactor”). (4) Pressure incorrect: set to 0.106 mmHg, whereas the article indicates atmospheric pressure with reported partial pressures (e.g., p(ZnCl2) ≈ 1.06×10^1 Pa, p(O2) ≈ 2.53×10^4 Pa). A total pressure near 760 mmHg should be reported; partial pressures are not captured elsewhere. (5) Flow rates: values (33 sccm for all streams) are not traceable; the article reports a total flow of 33×10^-6 m^3/s (~1980 sccm total), and per-stream flows are not provided. (6) NucleationPeriod = 5 cycles is not reported. (7) Many material and device properties are fabricated and not traceable to the article: refractive index, absorption coefficient, band gap, electrical properties (resistivity, carrier density, mobility), uniformity, conformality, elemental concentrations/ratios by XPS, roughness, density by XRR, TFT device metrics, film stability, and reproducibility. Only crystallinity (epitaxial by XRD) and film thickness (51.7 nm for 200 cycles at 748 K) are supported. To improve completeness: add separate processes for the different temperature regimes and cycle counts reported (or explicitly capture ranges where allowed); correct aldMethod to SALD; remove plasmaPower; correct dosing/purge time units; correct GPC to ~2.57 Å/cycle; set reactor pressure to ~760 mmHg and, if possible, reflect reported partial pressures; revise flow rates (use the reported total flow converted to sccm and avoid inventing per-stream values); set nucleationPeriod only if supported; remove or leave unspecified any material/device properties not reported in the article. Overall, the extraction contains many unsupported values and unit errors, so completeness is very bad.
